docs.title: "I" Adjectives
docs.text:
Present Affirmative Present Negative Past Affirmative Past Negative sugoi sugokunai sugokatta sugokunakatta
  1. Generally "i" adjectives end with the hiragana "い" Some exceptions exist like "kirei", "kirai", "yuumei", "teinei"
  2. ii becomes "yokunai, yokatta, yokunakatta"

docs.title: "NA" Adjectives
docs.text:
Present Affirmative Present Negative Past Affirmative Past Negative Formal suki desu suki desu suki dewa arimasen suki deshita Casual suki na suki dewa nai suki datta suki dewa nakatta
  1. "NA" adjectives generally come from borrowed chinese words

docs.title: Greetings
docs.text:
• Ohayou gozaimasu - Good morning
  • Konnichiwa - Hello/Good afternoon
  • Konbanwa - Good evening
  • Oyasumi nasai - Good night

docs.title: Introductions
docs.text:
• Hajimemashite - Nice to meet you
  • Watashi wa [name] desu - I am [name]
  • [Name] to moushimasu - I'm called [name] (polite)
  • Yoroshiku onegaishimasu - Please treat me well/Nice to meet you

docs.title: Where You Live
docs.text:
• Doko ni sunde imasu ka? - Where do you live?
  • Watashi wa [place] ni sunde imasu - I live in [place]
  • [Place] ni sundeiru n desu - I live in [place] (casual)
  • Nan-nen gurai [place] ni sunde imasu ka? - How many years have you lived in [place]?
  • [Place] wa dou desu ka? - How is [place]?

docs.title: Work/Occupation
docs.text:
• Oshigoto wa nan desu ka? - What is your job/occupation?
  • [Occupation] desu - I am a [occupation]
  • [Company] de hataraite imasu - I work at [company]
  • Watashi wa [occupation] o shite imasu - I work as a [occupation]
  • [Field] no shigoto o shite imasu - I work in [field]
  • Nani o oshiete imasu ka? - What do you teach? (for teachers)
  • Donna shigoto o shite imasu ka? - What kind of work do you do?

docs.title: Birthday
docs.text:
• Tanjoubi wa itsu desu ka? - When is your birthday?
  • Watashi no tanjoubi wa [month] [day] desu - My birthday is [month] [day]
  • Nan-gatsu nan-nichi ga tanjoubi desu ka? - Which month and day is your birthday?
  • [Season] umare desu - I was born in [season]

docs.title: Age
docs.text:
• Oikutsu desu ka? - How old are you? (polite)
  • [Number] sai desu - I am [number] years old
  • Toshi wa ikutsu desu ka? - How old are you? (alternative)
  • Nenrei wa? - Age? (casual)

docs.title: Origin/Hometown
docs.text:
• Doko no shusshin desu ka? - Where are you from?
  • Shusshin wa doko desu ka? - Where is your hometown?
  • [Place] shusshin desu - I'm from [place]
  • Kokuseki wa nan desu ka? - What is your nationality?
  • Watashi wa [nationality] jin desu - I am [nationality]
  • Watashi no furusato wa [place] desu - My hometown is [place]

docs.title: Family
docs.text:
• Kazoku wa nan-nin desu ka? - How many people are in your family?
  • Kyoudai wa imasu ka? - Do you have siblings?
  • [Number] nin kyoudai desu - I have [number] siblings
  • Ani/Ane/Otouto/Imouto ga imasu - I have an older brother/older sister/younger brother/younger sister
  • Kekkon shite imasu ka? - Are you married?
  • Kodomo wa imasu ka? - Do you have children?
  • Kodomo ga [number] nin imasu - I have [number] children

docs.title: Hobbies/Interests
docs.text:
• Shumi wa nan desu ka? - What are your hobbies?
  • Watashi no shumi wa [hobby] desu - My hobby is [hobby]
  • [Activity] ga suki desu - I like [activity]
  • Hima na toki ni nani o shimasu ka? - What do you do in your free time?
  • [Sport/instrument] o yarimasu - I play [sport/instrument]

docs.title: Language Ability
docs.text:
• Nihongo ga wakarimasu ka? - Do you understand Japanese?
  • [Language] o hanasemasu ka? - Can you speak [language]?
  • [Language] ga sukoshi wakarimasu - I understand a little [language]
  • Donna gengo o hanasemasu ka? - What languages do you speak?
  • [Language] o benkyou shite imasu - I'm studying [language]
  • Dono kurai [language] o benkyou shimashita ka? - How long have you studied [language]?

docs.title: Contact Information
docs.text:
• Denwa bangou wa nan desu ka? - What is your phone number?
  • Meeru adoresu o oshiete kudasai - Please tell me your email address
  • Renraku-saki o koekan shimashou ka? - Shall we exchange contact information?
  • SNS wa yatte imasu ka? - Do you use social media?

docs.title: First Meeting Context
docs.text:
• Dou yatte shirimashita ka? - How did you get to know (about this)?
  • Doko de aimashita ka? - Where did we meet?
  • [Person] san no tomodachi desu ka? - Are you [person]'s friend?
  • [Event] de hajimete aimashita ne - We first met at [event], right?

docs.title: Length of Stay
docs.text:
• Itsu kara [place] ni imasu ka? - Since when have you been in [place]?
  • Ato dono kurai koko ni imasu ka? - How much longer will you be here?
  • [Time period] kurai koko ni imasu - I'll be here for about [time period]

docs.title: Farewells
docs.text:
• Sayounara - Goodbye
  • Mata ne - See you later (casual)
  • Mata ashita - See you tomorrow
  • Itterasshai - Have a good day/Take care (when someone is leaving)
  • Ittekimasu - I'm leaving (said when you're the one leaving)
  • Tadaima - I'm home
  • Okaerinasai - Welcome home

docs.title: Basic Questions
docs.text:
• [Noun] wa nan desu ka? - What is [noun]?
  • Kore/Sore/Are wa nan desu ka? - What is this/that/that over there?
  • Doko desu ka? - Where is it?
  • Itsu desu ka? - When is it?
  • Dare desu ka? - Who is it?
  • Ikura desu ka? - How much is it?
  • Dou desu ka? - How is it?
  • Doushite desu ka? - Why is it?

docs.title: Preference Questions
docs.text:
• [Noun] ga suki desu ka? - Do you like [noun]?
  • [Noun] wa dou desu ka? - How about [noun]?
  • [Noun] to [noun], dochira ga ii desu ka? - Between [noun] and [noun], which is better?

docs.title: Requests
docs.text:
• [Verb te-form] kudasai - Please do [verb]
  • [Verb te-form] itadakemasenka? - Could you please do [verb]? (very polite)
  • [Verb te-form] moraemasuka? - Can I get you to do [verb]?
  • [Noun] o onegaishimasu - Please give me [noun]

docs.title: Offers
docs.text:
• [Verb mashō] ka? - Shall we [verb]?
  • [Verb te-form] mo ii desu ka? - Is it okay if I [verb]?
  • [Verb] mashou ka? - Shall I [verb]?
  • [Noun] wa ikaga desu ka? - Would you like [noun]?

docs.title: Giving
docs.text:
• [Noun] o agemasu - I'll give you [noun]
  • [Noun] o sashiagemasu - I'll give you [noun] (more polite)

docs.title: Receiving
docs.text:
• [Noun] o moraimasu - I'll receive [noun]
  • [Noun] o itadakimasu - I'll receive [noun] (polite)

docs.title: Agreement/Disagreement
docs.text:
• Hai, sou desu - Yes, that's right
  • Iie, chigaimasu - No, that's incorrect
  • Sou desu ne - That's right, isn't it?
  • Sou omoimasu - I think so
  • Sou omoimasen - I don't think so

docs.title: Opinions
docs.text:
• Watashi wa [noun] ga suki desu - I like [noun]
  • Watashi wa [noun] ga kirai desu - I dislike [noun]
  • [Noun] wa [adjective] to omoimasu - I think [noun] is [adjective]
  • Watashi no kangae dewa - In my opinion

docs.title: Can/Cannot
docs.text:
• [Verb dictionary form] koto ga dekimasu - I can [verb]
  • [Verb dictionary form] koto ga dekimasen - I cannot [verb]
  • [Verb potential form] - Can [verb]
  • [Verb potential form] + masen - Cannot [verb]

docs.title: Want/Don't Want
docs.text:
• [Noun] ga hoshii desu - I want [noun]
  • [Verb] tai desu - I want to [verb]
  • [Verb] tai to omoimasu - I think I want to [verb]
  • [Verb] nakatta desu - I didn't want to [verb]

docs.title: Past Experiences
docs.text:
• [Verb ta-form] koto ga arimasu - I have [verb] before
  • [Verb ta-form] koto ga arimasen - I have never [verb] before

docs.title: Plans and Intentions
docs.text:
• [Verb] tsumori desu - I intend to [verb]
  • [Verb] yotei desu - I plan to [verb]
  • [Verb] to omoimasu - I think I will [verb]

docs.title: If/When
docs.text:
• [Verb conditional form] to, [result] - If [verb], then [result]
  • [Verb ta-form] ra, [result] - If [verb], then [result]
  • [Verb dictionary form] nara, [result] - If [verb], then [result]
  • [Verb ba-form], [result] - If [verb], then [result]

docs.title: Because/Since
docs.text:
• [Reason] kara, [result] - Because [reason], [result]
  • [Reason] node, [result] - Since [reason], [result]

docs.title: Apologies
docs.text:
• Sumimasen - Excuse me/I'm sorry
  • Gomen nasai - I'm sorry
  • Moushiwake arimasen - I'm terribly sorry (formal)

docs.title: Thanks
docs.text:
• Arigatou - Thank you
  • Arigatou gozaimasu - Thank you (polite)
  • Doumo arigatou gozaimasu - Thank you very much (very polite)
  • Dou itashimashite - You're welcome

docs.title: At Stores/Restaurants
docs.text:
• [Noun] o kudasai - Please give me [noun]
  • [Noun] o misete kudasai - Please show me [noun]
  • Kore o onegaishimasu - I'll take this, please
  • Ikura desu ka? - How much is it?

docs.title: Class 1 (March 17th 2025)
docs.text:
1. Sumisu-san wa asatte basu de depaato ni ikimasu
  2. Sumisu-san wa ni sen nen ni Takahashi-san to shinkansen de Kyoto ni ikimashita
  3. Sumisu-san wa shichi-gatsu juu-go-nichi ni chikatetsu de taishikan ni ikumasu
  4. Sumusu-san wa ashite aruite uchi ni kaerimasu

* When using "Kyoo", "Kinoo", "Ashita", "Asatte", etc. we drop the "ni" afterwards * When using the verb "aruite" we drop the "de" afterwards

  1. Sumisu-san wa suiyoobi ni hitori de hikooki de Osaka-shisha ni ikimasu
  2. a) Sumisu-san wa kinyoobi no juu-ni-ji ni hisho to resutoran ni ikimasu b) Sumisu-san wa kinyoobi no yo-ji ni Sasaki-san to Yokohama-shisha ni ikimasu c) Sumisu-san wa kinyoobi no roku-ji ni Amerika no taishikan ni ikimasu
  3. a) Sumisu-san wa nichiyoobi no gozen ku-ji ni tomodachi to koen ni ikimasu b) Sumisu-san wa nichiyoobi no gogo shichi-ji ni Suzuki-san to tomodachi no uchi ni ikimasu

docs.title: は (wa) - Topic marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Marks the topic of a sentence
  • Example: Watashi wa gakusei desu. (I am a student.)

docs.title: が (ga) - Subject marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Marks the subject performing an action
  • Example: Ame ga futte imasu. (Rain is falling.)

docs.title: を (o) - Direct object marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Marks the direct object of an action
  • Example: Hon o yomimasu. (I read a book.)

docs.title: に (ni) - Direction/destination/time/indirect object marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates direction, destination, time, or indirect object
  • Example: Gakkou ni ikimasu. (I go to school.)

docs.title: へ (e) - Direction marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates direction (similar to に but emphasizes movement)
  • Example: Tokyo e ikimasu. (I'm going to Tokyo.)

docs.title: で (de) - Location of action/means marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates where an action takes place or the means by which it occurs
  • Example: Kouen de asonda. (I played in the park.)

docs.title: と (to) - And/with/quotation marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Connects nouns, indicates accompaniment, or marks quotations
  • Example: Tomodachi to eiga o mimashita. (I watched a movie with my friend.)

docs.title: も (mo) - Also/too marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates "also" or "too"
  • Example: Watashi mo ikimasu. (I will go too.)

docs.title: の (no) - Possessive marker/nominalizer
docs.text:
• Usage: Shows possession or connects nouns
  • Example: Watashi no hon. (My book.)

docs.title: か (ka) - Question marker
docs.text:
• Usage: Turns statements into questions
  • Example: Sushi ga suki desu ka? (Do you like sushi?)

docs.title: から (kara) - From/since/because
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates starting point in time or space, or reason
  • Example: Uchi kara gakkou made arukimasu. (I walk from home to school.)

docs.title: まで (made) - Until/to
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates endpoint in time or space
  • Example: Juuji made matteimasu. (I will wait until 10 o'clock.)

docs.title: より (yori) - Than/from
docs.text:
• Usage: Used in comparisons
  • Example: Kono hon wa sono hon yori omoshiroi desu. (This book is more interesting than that book.)

docs.title: ので (node) - Because/since
docs.text:
• Usage: Gives reason or cause (more formal than から)
  • Example: Ame ga futte iru node, kasa o mochimasu. (Because it's raining, I'll bring an umbrella.)

docs.title: けど/が (kedo/ga) - But/although
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates contrast or contradiction
  • Example: Yasui desu kedo, ii desu. (It's cheap, but it's good.)

docs.title: しか (shika) - Only/just
docs.text:
• Usage: Used with negative verbs to mean "only"
  • Example: Hyaku en shika arimasen. (I only have 100 yen.)

docs.title: だけ (dake) - Only/just
docs.text:
• Usage: Limits to "only" the preceding item
  • Example: Kore dake hoshii desu. (I want only this.)

docs.title: ばかり (bakari) - Only/just/nothing but
docs.text:
• Usage: Emphasizes exclusivity
  • Example: Taberu bakari desu. (All [they] do is eat.)

docs.title: でも (demo) - Even/also/but
docs.text:
• Usage: Means "even" or introduces contrast
  • Example: Kodomo demo dekimasu. (Even a child can do it.)

docs.title: さえ (sae) - Even
docs.text:
• Usage: Emphasizes extremity
  • Example: Kodomo sae shitte imasu. (Even children know it.)

docs.title: など/なんか (nado/nanka) - Et cetera/things like
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates examples of a category
  • Example: Ringo ya banana nado ga suki desu. (I like apples, bananas, and such.)

docs.title: までに (made ni) - By/until
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates deadline
  • Example: Juuji made ni kaerimashou. (Let's return by 10 o'clock.)

docs.title: について (ni tsuite) - About/concerning
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates topic of discussion
  • Example: Nihon ni tsuite hanashimashou. (Let's talk about Japan.)

docs.title: によって (ni yotte) - By means of/depending on
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates means or dependency
  • Example: Joutai ni yotte henka shimasu. (It changes depending on the situation.)

docs.title: として (to shite) - As/in the capacity of
docs.text:
• Usage: Indicates role or capacity
  • Example: Sensei to shite hataraite imasu. (I work as a teacher.)

docs.title: Degree and Intensity
docs.text: English Romaji Hiragana Example Sentence Very totemo とても この本はとても面白いです。(Kono hon wa totemo omoshiroi desu.) – This book is very interesting. A little sukoshi すこし 日本語がすこしわかります。(Nihongo ga sukoshi wakarimasu.) – I understand a little Japanese. Not much amari あまり あまり好きじゃないです。(Amari suki janai desu.) – I don’t like it very much. Not at all zenzen ぜんぜん ぜんぜん疲れていません。(Zenzen tsukarete imasen.) – I’m not tired at all. Extremely hijou ni ひじょうに この問題はひじょうに難しいです。(Kono mondai wa hijou ni muzukashii desu.) – This problem is extremely difficult. Quite kanari かなり 彼の歌はかなり上手です。(Kare no uta wa kanari jouzu desu.) – His singing is quite good.

docs.title: Frequency
docs.text: English Romaji Hiragana Example Sentence Often yoku よく 彼女はよく映画を見ます。(Kanojo wa yoku eiga o mimasu.) – She often watches movies. Sometimes tokidoki ときどき ときどき海に行きます。(Tokidoki umi ni ikimasu.) – I sometimes go to the sea. Rarely metta ni めったに めったに雨が降りません。(Metta ni ame ga furimasen.) – It rarely rains. Always itsumo いつも 彼はいつも早起きします。(Kare wa itsumo hayaoki shimasu.) – He always wakes up early. Never kesshite けっして けっして嘘をつきません。(Kesshite uso o tsukimasen.) – I never tell lies.

docs.title: Time
docs.text: English Romaji Hiragana Example Sentence Already mou もう もう宿題を終わらせました。(Mou shukudai o owarasemashita.) – I’ve already finished my homework. Just now tadaima ただいま 彼はただいま帰宅しました。(Kare wa tadaima kitaku shimashita.) – He just got home. Soon sugu すぐ すぐに電話をします。(Sugu ni denwa o shimasu.) – I’ll call you soon. Recently saikin さいきん 最近忙しいです。(Saikin isogashii desu.) – I’ve been busy recently. Still mada まだ まだ宿題が終わっていません。(Mada shukudai ga owatteimasen.) – I still haven’t finished my homework. Yet mada まだ 彼はまだ帰っていません。(Kare wa mada kaetteimasen.) – He hasn’t come back yet.

docs.title: Manner
docs.text: English Romaji Hiragana Example Sentence Quickly hayaku はやく はやく走ってください。(Hayaku hashitte kudasai.) – Please run quickly. Slowly yukkuri ゆっくり ゆっくり話してください。(Yukkuri hanashite kudasai.) – Please speak slowly. Quietly shizuka ni しずかに しずかに座ってください。(Shizuka ni suwatte kudasai.) – Please sit quietly. Loudly ookiku おおきく おおきく話してください。(Ookiku hanashite kudasai.) – Please speak loudly. Well yoku よく 彼はよく泳げます。(Kare wa yoku oyogemasu.) – He can swim well. Badly waruku わるく 英語をわるく話します。(Eigo o waruku hanashimasu.) – I speak English badly.

docs.title: Certainty
docs.text: English Romaji Hiragana Example Sentence Definitely kanarazu かならず かならず戻ります。(Kanarazu modorimasu.) – I will definitely return. Probably tabun たぶん たぶん雨が降ります。(Tabun ame ga furimasu.) – It will probably rain. Surely tashika ni たしかに たしかに彼は正しいです。(Tashika ni kare wa tadashii desu.) – Surely, he is correct. Maybe osoraku おそらく おそらく彼は来ないでしょう。(Osoraku kare wa konai deshou.) – Maybe he won’t come.

docs.title: Verbs
docs.text: Dictionary Form Meaning Masu Form Te Form Negative Past Past Negative Example 行く (iku) to go 行きます (ikimasu) 行って (itte) 行かない (ikanai) 行った (itta) 行かなかった (ikanakatta) Gakkou ni ikimasu. (I go to school.) 来る (kuru) to come 来ます (kimasu) 来て (kite) 来ない (konai) 来た (kita) 来なかった (konakatta) Tomodachi ga kimasu. (My friend is coming.) 食べる (taberu) to eat 食べます (tabemasu) 食べて (tabete) 食べない (tabenai) 食べた (tabeta) 食べなかった (tabenakatta) Gohan o tabemasu. (I eat rice.) 飲む (nomu) to drink 飲みます (nomimasu) 飲んで (nonde) 飲まない (nomanai) 飲んだ (nonda) 飲まなかった (nomanakatta) Ocha o nomimasu. (I drink tea.) 見る (miru) to see/watch 見ます (mimasu) 見て (mite) 見ない (minai) 見た (mita) 見なかった (minakatta) Eiga o mimasu. (I watch a movie.) 聞く (kiku) to hear/listen/ask 聞きます (kikimasu) 聞いて (kiite) 聞かない (kikanai) 聞いた (kiita) 聞かなかった (kikanakatta) Ongaku o kikimasu. (I listen to music.) 読む (yomu) to read 読みます (yomimasu) 読んで (yonde) 読まない (yomanai) 読んだ (yonda) 読まなかった (yomanakatta) Hon o yomimasu. (I read a book.) 書く (kaku) to write 書きます (kakimasu) 書いて (kaite) 書かない (kakanai) 書いた (kaita) 書かなかった (kakanakatta) Tegami o kakimasu. (I write a letter.) 話す (hanasu) to speak/talk 話します (hanashimasu) 話して (hanashite) 話さない (hanasanai) 話した (hanashita) 話さなかった (hanasanakatta) Nihongo o hanashimasu. (I speak Japanese.) する (suru) to do します (shimasu) して (shite) しない (shinai) した (shita) しなかった (shinakatta) Shukudai o shimasu. (I do homework.) 寝る (neru) to sleep 寝ます (nemasu) 寝て (nete) 寝ない (nenai) 寝た (neta) 寝なかった (nenakatta) Hayaku nemasu. (I sleep early.) 起きる (okiru) to wake up 起きます (okimasu) 起きて (okite) 起きない (okinai) 起きた (okita) 起きなかった (okinakatta) Roku-ji ni okimasu. (I wake up at 6 o'clock.) 死ぬ (shinu) to die 死にます (shinimasu) 死んで (shinde) 死なない (shinanai) 死んだ (shinda) 死ななかった (shinanakatta) Hana ga shinimasu. (The flower dies.) 買う (kau) to buy 買います (kaimasu) 買って (katte) 買わない (kawanai) 買った (katta) 買わなかった (kawanakatta) Pan o kaimasu. (I buy bread.) 歌う (utau) to sing 歌います (utaimasu) 歌って (utatte) 歌わない (utawanai) 歌った (utatta) 歌わなかった (utawanakatta) Uta o utaimasu. (I sing a song.) 泳ぐ (oyogu) to swim 泳ぎます (oyogimasu) 泳いで (oyoide) 泳がない (oyoganai) 泳いだ (oyoida) 泳がなかった (oyoganakatta) Umi de oyogimasu. (I swim in the sea.) 遊ぶ (asobu) to play 遊びます (asobimasu) 遊んで (asonde) 遊ばない (asobanai) 遊んだ (asonda) 遊ばなかった (asobanakatta) Kouen de asobimasu. (I play in the park.) 待つ (matsu) to wait 待ちます (machimasu) 待って (matte) 待たない (matanai) 待った (matta) 待たなかった (matanakatta) Densha o machimasu. (I wait for the train.) 走る (hashiru) to run 走ります (hashirimasu) 走って (hashitte) 走らない (hashiranai) 走った (hashitta) 走らなかった (hashiranakatta) Maiasa hashirimasu. (I run every morning.) 歩く (aruku) to walk 歩きます (arukimasu) 歩いて (aruite) 歩かない (arukanai) 歩いた (aruita) 歩かなかった (arukanakatta) Machi o arukimasu. (I walk in the town.) 勉強する (benkyou suru) to study 勉強します (benkyou shimasu) 勉強して (benkyou shite) 勉強しない (benkyou shinai) 勉強した (benkyou shita) 勉強しなかった (benkyou shinakatta) Nihongo o benkyou shimasu. (I study Japanese.) 分かる (wakaru) to understand 分かります (wakarimasu) 分かって (wakatte) 分からない (wakaranai) 分かった (wakatta) 分からなかった (wakaranakatta) Nihongo ga wakarimasu. (I understand Japanese.) 教える (oshieru) to teach 教えます (oshiemasu) 教えて (oshiete) 教えない (oshienai) 教えた (oshieta) 教えなかった (oshienakatta) Nihongo o oshiemasu. (I teach Japanese.) 学ぶ (manabu) to learn 学びます (manabimasu) 学んで (manande) 学ばない (manabanai) 学んだ (mananda) 学ばなかった (manabanakatta) Rekishi o manabimasu. (I learn history.) 言う (iu) to say 言います (iimasu) 言って (itte) 言わない (iwanai) 言った (itta) 言わなかった (iwanakatta) Arigatou to iimasu. (I say thank you.) 思う (omou) to think 思います (omoimasu) 思って (omotte) 思わない (omowanai) 思った (omotta) 思わなかった (omowanakatta) Sou omoimasu. (I think so.) 知る (shiru) to know 知ります (shirimasu) 知って (shitte) 知らない (shiranai) 知った (shitta) 知らなかった (shiranakatta) Kanojo o shirimasu. (I know her.) 入る (hairu) to enter 入ります (hairimasu) 入って (haitte) 入らない (hairanai) 入った (haitta) 入らなかった (hairanakatta) Heya ni hairimasu. (I enter the room.) 出る (deru) to leave/exit 出ます (demasu) 出て (dete) 出ない (denai) 出た (deta) 出なかった (denakatta) Ie o demasu. (I leave the house.) あげる (ageru) to give あげます (agemasu) あげて (agete) あげない (agenai) あげた (ageta) あげなかった (agenakatta) Purezento o agemasu. (I give a present.) もらう (morau) to receive もらいます (moraimasu) もらって (moratte) もらわない (morawanai) もらった (moratta) もらわなかった (morawanakatta) Tegami o moraimasu. (I receive a letter.) ある (aru) to exist (inanimate) あります (arimasu) あって (atte) ない (nai) あった (atta) なかった (nakatta) Tsukue no ue ni hon ga arimasu. (There is a book on the desk.) いる (iru) to exist (animate) います (imasu) いて (ite) いない (inai) いた (ita) いなかった (inakatta) Niwa ni neko ga imasu. (There is a cat in the garden.) 開ける (akeru) to open 開けます (akemasu) 開けて (akete) 開けない (akenai) 開けた (aketa) 開けなかった (akenakatta) Mado o akemasu. (I open the window.) 閉める (shimeru) to close 閉めます (shimemasu) 閉めて (shimete) 閉めない (shimenai) 閉めた (shimeta) 閉めなかった (shimenakatta) Doa o shimemasu. (I close the door.) 作る (tsukuru) to make 作ります (tsukurimasu) 作って (tsukutte) 作らない (tsukuranai) 作った (tsukutta) 作らなかった (tsukuranakatta) Gohan o tsukurimasu. (I make rice.) 落ちる (ochiru) to fall 落ちます (ochimasu) 落ちて (ochite) 落ちない (ochinai) 落ちた (ochita) 落ちなかった (ochinakatta) Ha ga ochimasu. (The leaf falls.) 忘れる (wasureru) to forget 忘れます (wasuremasu) 忘れて (wasurete) 忘れない (wasurenai) 忘れた (wasureta) 忘れなかった (wasurenakatta) Kagi o wasuremasu. (I forget the key.) 覚える (oboeru) to remember/memorize 覚えます (oboemasu) 覚えて (oboete) 覚えない (oboenai) 覚えた (oboeta) 覚えなかった (oboenakatta) Namae o oboemasu. (I remember the name.) 考える (kangaeru) to think/consider 考えます (kangaemasu) 考えて (kangaete) 考えない (kangaenai) 考えた (kangaeta) 考えなかった (kangaenakatta) Mondai o kangaemasu. (I think about the problem.) 信じる (shinjiru) to believe 信じます (shinjimasu) 信じて (shinjite) 信じない (shinjinai) 信じた (shinjita) 信じなかった (shinjinakatta) Kare o shinjimasu. (I believe him.) 持つ (motsu) to hold/have 持ちます (mochimasu) 持って (motte) 持たない (motanai) 持った (motta) 持たなかった (motanakatta) Kaban o mochimasu. (I have a bag.) 呼ぶ (yobu) to call 呼びます (yobimasu) 呼んで (yonde) 呼ばない (yobanai) 呼んだ (yonda) 呼ばなかった (yobanakatta) Tomodachi o yobimasu. (I call my friend.) 投げる (nageru) to throw 投げます (nagemasu) 投げて (nagete) 投げない (nagenai) 投げた (nageta) 投げなかった (nagenakatta) Booru o nagemasu. (I throw the ball.) 取る (toru) to take/get 取ります (torimasu) 取って (totte) 取らない (toranai) 取った (totta) 取らなかった (toranakatta) Shashin o torimasu. (I take a photo.) 座る (suwaru) to sit 座ります (suwarimasu) 座って (suwatte) 座らない (suwaranai) 座った (suwatta) 座らなかった (suwaranakatta) Isu ni suwarimasu. (I sit on a chair.) 立つ (tatsu) to stand 立ちます (tachimasu) 立って (tatte) 立たない (tatanai) 立った (tatta) 立たなかった (tatanakatta) Koko ni tachimasu. (I stand here.) 泣く (naku) to cry 泣きます (nakimasu) 泣いて (naite) 泣かない (nakanai) 泣いた (naita) 泣かなかった (nakanakatta) Kodomo ga nakimasu. (The child cries.) 笑う (warau) to laugh 笑います (waraimasu) 笑って (waratte) 笑わない (warawanai) 笑った (waratta) 笑わなかった (warawanakatta) Minna ga waraimasu. docs.title: "Nan" words
docs.text: English Meaning Romaji Example and Translation What time nanji 今、なんじですか？ (Ima, nanji desu ka?) – What time is it now? What number nanban この電車はなんばん線ですか？ (Kono densha wa nanban-sen desu ka?) – What number line is this train? How many people nannin クラスにはなんにんいますか？ (Kurasu ni wa nannin imasu ka?) – How many people are in the class? What year nannen この会社はなんねんに創立されましたか？ (Kono kaisha wa nannen ni souritsu saremashita ka?) – What year was this company founded? How old nansai 子供はなんさいですか？ (Kodomo wa nansai desu ka?) – How old is the child? What day nannichi あなたの誕生日はなんにちですか？ (Anata no tanjoubi wa nannichi desu ka?) – What day is your birthday? What day of the week nanyoubi 今日なんようびですか？ (Kyou nanyoubi desu ka?) – What day of the week is it today? What kind nan no なんの本が好きですか？ (Nan no hon ga suki desu ka?) – What kind of books do you like? Anything nandemo なんでもできます。 (Nandemo dekimasu.) – I can do anything. Why/How nande なんでここに来たのですか？ (Nande koko ni kita no desu ka?) – Why did you come here? What is it nanda それはなんだ？ (Sore wa nanda?) – What is that? What for nan no tame これはなんのためですか？ (Kore wa nan no tame desu ka?) – What is this for? How many things nanko りんごはなんこありますか？ (Ringo wa nanko arimasu ka?) – How many apples are there? How much (quantity) nan mai 紙をなんまい用意しますか？ (Kami o nan mai youi shimasu ka?) – How many sheets of paper should I prepare? How many times nankai なんかい行けばいいですか？ (Nankai ikeba ii desu ka?) – How many times should I go?
